Kang Daniel

Wanna One

Introduction

Kang Daniel is a South Korean singer, songwriter, and actor under ARA. He first gained prominence after winning first place on Produce 101 Season 2 in 2017, earning the center position in the project group Wanna One. The group debuted on August 7, 2017, with 1X1=1 (To Be One) and quickly became one of the most successful acts in K-pop during their active years. Following their final album 1¹¹=1 (Power of Destiny) in November 2018, Wanna One officially disbanded on December 31, 2018.

After parting ways with LM Entertainment in 2019, Kang Daniel founded KONNECT Entertainment and launched his solo career. His first special album, Color On Me, was released on July 25, 2019, marking a strong start to his independent musical journey. He continued to build his discography with the Color Trilogy series, which included Cyan (2020), Magenta (2020), and Yellow (2021), showcasing his versatility as an artist. His first full-length album, The Story, was released in May 2022, followed by his Japanese debut EP Joy Ride in October 2022. He further solidified his presence in the Japanese market with Re8el in November 2023.

Beyond music, Kang Daniel ventured into acting, making his official debut in 2022 as the lead in Disney+ original series Rookie Cops. He also became a well-known television personality, serving as the MC for Mnet’s hit dance competition Street Woman Fighter 2 in 2023. His continued success in both entertainment and music led to the release of his fourth mini album Realiez in June 2023, featuring the pre-release single Wasteland.

In May 2024, Kang Daniel filed a criminal lawsuit against the major shareholder of KONNECT Entertainment for various charges, including embezzlement and fraud. As a result, KONNECT officially shut down in June 2024, and he departed from the company. Shortly after, on July 25, 2024, he signed an exclusive contract with ARA, an agency founded by a former KONNECT executive with experience at YG Entertainment and BigHit Music. Under his new agency, he released his fifth mini album Act on September 23, 2024.

Kang Daniel pursued his education at Kyunghee Cyber University after obtaining his GED during Produce 101. In his personal life, he was in a public relationship with TWICE’s Jihyo from August 2019 to November 2020. In December 2019, he was diagnosed with depression and panic disorder, leading to a temporary hiatus from activities. He resumed his career in February 2020 after focusing on treatment and recovery.

With a career spanning music, acting, and television, Kang Daniel continues to evolve as an artist, maintaining a strong presence in both the Korean and international entertainment industries. On August 29, Kang Daniel revealed his official fandom name as FLOWD. It's a combination of "FLOW" and the "D" from Daniel, symbolizing those who are immersed in Kang Daniel enough to forget the flow of time and those who love the flow created by Kang Daniel.
